writeRelation

public void writeRelation(Relation aRelation)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Write the given relation. If it is already stored in the ways-File, the old records are overwritten. If we require more or less records then before, allocation and deallocation are done here too.

Parameters:
aRelation - the relation to store
Throws:
java.io.IOException - on problems growing the file

findRecordForRelation

public int findRecordForRelation(long aRelationID)
                          throws java.io.IOException
Return the first of the consecutive record where this relation is stored.

Parameters:
aRelationID - the relation to look for
Returns:
the record-number of the node or -1
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if we cannot read the records

removeRelation

public void removeRelation(Relation aRelation)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Mark all records of the given relation as free.

Parameters:
aRelation - the relation to remove from storage
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the way cannot be removed from the index

Parameters:

Returns:
